name: Skeleton Words 16 Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: MNMM (The least amount recorded, allowed or reached)
BLV (To have religious faith)
SQZ (To grip or press firmly so as to crush, distort or compress)
STRDS (Any of numerous small celestial bodies that move around the Sun mainly between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter)
LXR (An alchemical preparation supposed to be capable of prolonging life indefinitely)
HRTCH (Intense anguish or mental suffering)
PRC (To form or cut a hole in something with a sharp instrument)
CLT (A feline mammal inhabiting the forests of Central and South America having a dark-spotted buff-brown coat)
T (The ninth letter of the Greek alphabet)
GNVR (The wife of King Arthur and the lover of Lancelot)
STDDFD (Any of a number of annual festivals in Wales in which competitions are held in music, poetry, drama and the fine arts)
SCMTR (An oriental sword with a curved blade broadening towards the point)
LJH (Hebrew prophet taken into heaven in a fiery chariot)
TQTT (The customs or rules governing behavior regarded as correct or acceptable in social or official life)
NTRS (1946 movie directed by Alfred Hitchcock)
questions.explanation:
Notorious.

	A romantic spy thriller starring Ingrid Bergman, Cary Grant and Claude Rains.

questions.text: GWN (The nephew of King Arthur and the son of Morgan Le Fay who searched for the Holy Grail)
XHS (A member of a cattle rearing Negroid people of southern Africa)
SH (The greatest Old Testament prophet)
HPLLGY (The study of weapons or armour)
BLTT (A dungeon the only entrance to which is through the top)
FNTNBL (One of the largest royal residences in France built largely by Francis I in the 16th century)
VRDPS (A system of weights used in many English speaking countries based on the pound weight containing 16 ounces)
BRMMRG (The village in upper Bavaria famous for its Passion Play performed by the villagers every ten years since 1634)
questions.explanation:
Oberammergau.

	This was performed in thanksgiving for the end of the Black Death.

questions.text: GR (God of the sea in Norse mythology)
GDG (A capital city of the world)
questions.explanation:
Ouagadougou.

	The capital of Burkina Faso in west Africa. Hope you enjoyed this tougher skeleton word quiz.
